## ğŸ“˜ Core Definitions for TutorBot Reader

### ğŸ¤– **LLM (Large Language Model)**
A machine learning model trained on huge amounts of text to understand, generate, and respond to natural language queries.

ğŸ§  LLMs power chatbots like TutorBot Readerâ€”but without retrieval augmentation, they may â€œhallucinateâ€ or rely too heavily on training patterns.

### ğŸ“ **Context Window**
The maximum amount of text (tokens) a language model can process at once. It limits how much background the model can â€œseeâ€ when answering a question.

ğŸ” Why it matters for RAG:
- If a modelâ€™s context window is small (e.g. 4k tokens), it needs helpâ€”RAG fetches only the relevant chunks to stay within limits.
- Larger windows (like 10 million tokens in new models) reduce this bottleneck, but RAG still adds grounding and modularity.

### ğŸ” **RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation)**
A technique that combines external document retrieval with language model generationâ€”so responses are grounded in real data, not just what the model â€œremembersâ€.

### ğŸ§  **RAG Framework**
A software toolkit or system that helps developers build RAG pipelines using modular tools like retrievers, chunkers, vector databases, and LLMs.

ğŸ§© Examples include LangChain, LlamaIndex, or RAGStackâ€”each supports chaining together retrieval and generation logic.
